sub_topic: Determining the length of a diagonal in a rectangular prism.
message_1: A rectangular prism has a length of 8 cm, width of 6 cm, and height of 10 cm. What is the length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism? Round your answer to one decimal place.
message_2:
To find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism, we can use the 3D Pythagorean theorem:

Diagonal length = √(length² + width² + height²)

In this case, the length is 8 cm, the width is 6 cm, and the height is 10 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Diagonal length = √(8² + 6² + 10²) = √(64 + 36 + 100) = √200

Now, we can approximate the square root of 200:

√200 ≈ 14.1

So, the length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism is approximately 14.1 cm.
